'Christiaan Huygens', FRS ( or ; ) () (14 April 1629 â 8 July 1695) was a
prominent Dutch mathematician and natural philosopher. He is known particularly
as an astronomer, physicist, probabilist and horologist.

Huygens was a leading natural philosopher of his time. His work included early
telescopic studies of the rings of Saturn and the discovery of its moon Titan,
the invention of the pendulum clock and other investigations in timekeeping.
He published major studies of mechanics and optics, and a pioneer work on
games of chance.
